intro: Gaylussacia densa var. cuneata, commonly known as the black huckleberry, is a shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are edible and often used in local foraging. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a leathery texture. The plant thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and swamps.
